N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 56.4 - Safety bumpers on buses

State Regulations
(a) Notwithstanding subdivision 3 of section
385
of
the Vehicle and Traffic Law, buses may exceed the legal length limitation by up
to one foot in the front and up to one foot in the rear if the overage is
caused solely by safety bumpers. (b) A safety bumper is defined as a device
which may be fitted on an existing bumper on which is the bumper and which is
so designed and constructed that its primary purpose is to absorb energy in
event of a crash. (c) Nothing in
this Part shall be construed as allowing the body of a bus, excluding safety
bumpers, to exceed the length limit set by section
385
of
the Vehicle and Traffic Law. Notes
